entries.name: body
entries.desc: Body may be:  a String;  an IO-like object that responds to #read and #readpartial;  a Proc-like object that responds to #call.  In the latter case, either chunked= should be set to true, or header['content-length'] explicitly provided. Example: server.mount_proc '/' do |req, res|   res.chunked = true   # or   # res.header['content-length'] = 10   res.body = proc { |out| out.write(Time.now.to_s) } end

entries.name: filename
entries.desc: Filename of the static file in this response.  Only used by the FileHandler servlet.

entries.name: request_http_version
entries.desc: Request HTTP version for this response

entries.name: new(config)
entries.desc: Creates a new HTTP response object.  WEBrick::Config::HTTP is the default configuration.

entries.name: []=(field, value)
entries.desc: Sets the response header field to value

entries.name: chunked?()
entries.desc: Will this response body be returned using chunked transfer-encoding?

entries.name: content_length=(len)
entries.desc: Sets the content-length header to len

entries.name: content_type=(type)
entries.desc: Sets the content-type header to type

entries.name: each()
entries.desc: Iterates over each header in the response

entries.name: keep_alive?()
entries.desc: Will this response's connection be kept alive?

entries.name: set_error(ex, backtrace=false)
entries.desc: Creates an error page for exception ex with an optional backtrace

entries.name: set_redirect(status, url)
entries.desc: Redirects to url with a WEBrick::HTTPStatus::Redirect status.

entries.name: status=(status)
entries.desc: Sets the response's status to the status code
